trans-unit.source: Provides a designer that enables you to visually design composite activities.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Use the CompositeActivityDesigner to visually design composite activities, to customize the layout, and to manage the drawing of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity>.
The CompositeActivityDesigner also enables you to manage events for the contained activity designers.
It also enables you to customize and manage the position, size, and layout of contained activity designers.
When implemented in a derived class, initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that accessibility applications use to adjust the application look and feel for people with disabilities.
If no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> is currently assigned to the control, a new instance of one is created.
> [!NOTE] > To get or set the AccessibilityObject property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
For more information about accessible objects, see the Active Accessibility section of the MSDN Library.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> associated with the control.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> can be collapsed.
Some composite designers will have multiple designers within.
These designers can implement expanding or collapsing to save room on the screen.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified composite activity designer can be collapsed; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether activities can be inserted into the composite activity associated with the designer.
Use CanInsertActivities to determine if a list of activities can be inserted into a composite activity.
The location to insert the activities.
A read-only array of <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to insert.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if activities can be inserted into the composite activity associated with the designer; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether activities contained within the composite activity can be moved out of the composite activity associated with the designer.
Use CanMoveActivities to determine if a list of activities can be moved from within a composite activity.
The location from which to move the activities.
The read-only array of activities to move.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the activities can be moved from the composite activity; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates if activities can be removed from the composite activity associated with the designer.
Use CanRemoveActivities to determine if a list of contained activities can be removed from the composite activity.
A read-only array of activities to remove from the composite activity associated with the designer.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the activities can be removed from the composite activity; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets the array of <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> contained within the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Use the ContainedDesigners accessor to retrieve a read-only collection of the designers contained within the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
The read-only collection of <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Deserializes items from an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref> received during a drag-and-drop operation or from the clipboard.
Component serialization service.
Object that contains activities to deserialize.
An array of activities deserialized from an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Verifies that the contained designer is visible.
Use EnsureVisibleContainedDesigner to make sure the contained designer is visible.
In a custom designer you can use EnsureVisibleContainedDesigner to make visible a designer located within a collapsed composite designer.
The contained designer to make visible.
Gets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the expand or collapse button.

Use ExpandButtonRectangle to return a <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> that describes the area of the screen that encloses the expand button on a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
This is useful for detecting mouse events to react to your requests to expand or collapse a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that encloses the expand or collapse button.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> is expanded.

In combination with <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.OnMouseDown%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.ExpandButtonRectangle%2A>, use Expanded to determine the proper action when a user clicks the expand or collapse button on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> is expanded; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the first selectable object in the navigation order of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, use FirstSelectableObject to return the first selectable object contained within the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
The first selectable object contained within the designer.
Retrieves designers belonging to the specified root activity that intersect a specified area.
The top-level designer to analyze.
Area within the top-level designer to analyze.
An array of <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> objects that intersect a portion of the Rectangle specified.
Gets the object which is next in the order of navigation.
GetNextSelectableObject causes the selection to move from the current selection to the next selectable object in the direction specified.
The current object in the navigation order.
The direction to navigate.
0 = next; 1 = previous; 2 = left; 3 = right.
The object that is next in the order of navigation.
Gets a collection of glyphs with which to adorn the composite activity designer.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerGlyphCollection"></xref> that contains the glyphs to display on the designer.
Gets information about the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> at a specified point on the screen.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>, together with the HitTest method of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner> control is used to determine which part of a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner> controls you have clicked.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> contains logical coordinates of the point on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner> where the mouse was clicked.
The HitTest method receives a <xref:System.Drawing.Point> that contains an x and y coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents a single x and y coordinate.

A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> that contains information about the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> at a specified point.
Gets the value for the enclosing bounds of the image associated with the designer in logical coordinates.
Use the ImageRectangle to retrieve the coordinates for the rectangle that encloses the image associated with the designer.
You can use these coordinates for drawing connectors or overlaying graphics.
A rectangle that encloses the <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> displayed for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Initializes the designer with the associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Initialize loads the designer with the specified <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
The designer loads the activity service, updates the verbs associated with the activity, and assigns the default text and image to the designer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> with which the designer should be initialized.
Inserts the specified activities in the designer at the specified location.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.InsertActivities%2A> to insert a list of activities into the location specified.
Prior to calling InsertActivities, use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.CanInsertActivities%2A> to make sure that the specified activities can be inserted.
The location in the designer to insert the activities.
The list of activities to insert.
Inserts activities into the designer at the specified location using a transaction.
Use InsertActivities to insert a list of activities into the composite activity.
Prior to calling InsertActivities, use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.CanInsertActivities%2A> to make sure the specified list of activities can be inserted.
The designer into which the activities will be inserted.
The location in the designer at which the activities will be inserted.
The list of activities to insert.
Description for the designer transaction created by the insertion.
Gets a value that indicates if the contained designer is visible.
Use IsContainedDesignerVisible to determine if the specified designer is visible.
The designer contained within the CompositeActivityDesigner to test for visibility.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the contained designer is visible; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the designer can be edited.
Some custom activities might not allow you to modify properties or other settings in the design environment.
The IsEditable property should determine whether the designer allows edits at design time.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the designer can be edited; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the last selectable object contained within the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, use LastSelectableObject to return the last selectable object contained within the designer.
The last selectable object contained within the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Restores the view state from a binary stream.
Use LoadViewState to restore the designer to a state previously saved using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.SaveViewState%2A>.
The <xref:System.IO.BinaryReader> from which to load the view state.
Gets or sets the location of the designer in logical coordinates.
Use Location to position the designer at design or run time.
The location of the designer in logical coordinates.
Moves activities from one designer to another.
Use MoveActivities to move a list of activities from one composite activity to another.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> describing the location to which to move the activities.
The list of activities to move.
Moves a designer forward or backwards in index within the composite activity.
Use MoveDesigners to move an activity contained within the composite activity forward or backwards in the index of contained activities.
The activity designer to move.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to move the designer backwards; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to move the designer forward.
Occurs when more than one activities contained within the designers have changed.
This occurs, for example, when a new child activity is added or an existing child activity is removed.
Use OnContainedActivitiesChanged to respond to changes to activities inside the composite activity.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityCollectionChangeEventArgs"></xref> containing information about the change.
listChangeArgs contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Occurs when an activity or a group of activities contained within the designer are changing.
This occurs, for example, when a new child activity is added or an existing child activity is removed.
Use OnContainedActivitiesChanging to respond to changes that are occurring to the activities contained within the composite activity.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityCollectionChangeEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the change.
listChangeArgs contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Occurs when an activity contained within the designer has changed.
Use OnContainedActivityChanged to respond to changes in the activities contained within the composite activity.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains information about the change.
e contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Called when a key is pressed with the designer in focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

Performs layout and positioning tasks for the contained visual cues or designers on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> to reposition its child activities.
OnLayoutPosition performs layout tasks for all of the child activity designers that the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner> contains.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Called to calculate the size needed for an activity based on its current state (collapsed or expanded) and its list of child activities.
OnLayoutSize performs resizing tasks for each activity designer that the composite activity designer contains.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that contains the new size settings for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Called when the mouse is clicked when the pointer is in designer bounds.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
- Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
- If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
- If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
- If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

- If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the `Action` property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up-to-date feedback about the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Draws the visual representation of a composite activity at design time.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the drawing data.
Notifies the designer that the associated theme has changed.
OnThemeChange occurs any time the theme associated with the designer changes.
When the theme changes it is likely that the designer look and feel needs to change.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme"></xref> that contains the event data.
Adjusts the clip region on the graphics object and calls <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.OnPaint*> on all contained designers.
<xref:System.EventArgs> to be used for painting.
Removes a list of activities from the composite activity designer.
Removes the list of activities from the composite activity.
A list of activities to remove from the designer.
Removes the list of activities from the designer using a transaction.
Use RemoveActivities to remove the specified list of activities from the composite activity within the specified transaction.
The service provider associated with the designer.
The list of activities to remove.
The description of the transaction created.
Saves the view state to a binary stream.
Use SaveViewState to save the state of a composite activity to a stream.
To restore the view state use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner.LoadViewState%2A>.
The <xref:System.IO.BinaryWriter> into which the view state is stored.
Serializes an array of activities to an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref> that can be placed into the clipboard or used when initializing a drag and drop operation.
Component serialization service.
Array of activities to serialize.
<xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject"></xref> that contains serialized activities.
Gets the value of the description rectangle in logical coordinates.
Use to determine the location on the designer where the text description will be displayed.
The value of the description rectangle in logical coordinates.
Gets the height of the title area of the designer.
The TitleHeight describes the height of the title area of the designer.
Typically this can contain the heading, icon, and expand or collapse button.
The height in pixels of the title area of the designer.
